intro: Dorstenia renulata, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Dorstenia renulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique foliage.
